title: Damiana Leaf Benefits, How Much To Consume, And Risks
author: Swathi Handoo Swathi Handoo
description: Damiana leaf benefits are numerous. From aiding digestion to relieving anxiety, the leaves exhibit many positive effects on one's health. Learn more here.
cleaned_text: How Much To Consume, And Risks From sexual health to anxiety - this powerful herb can help manage and relieve many issues. Damiana leaf is a herb known for its aphrodisiac properties. This herbal remedy has been used in folk medicine and is native to Central America. The health benefits of the damiana leaf can be linked to its active components. It can help boost sexual desire, control anxiety and depression, promote digestion, and reduce diabetes risk. This article explores the health benefits, dosage, and risks associated with damiana leaf. Keep reading. What Is It? It is the leaf of a woody shrub native to America. What Are Its Benefits? Damiana leaf can help improve sexual performance, prevent menstrual cramps, reduce depression and anxiety, regulate blood glucose levels, and improve digestion. Who Can Consume It? It is safe for adult consumption, but not for pregnant women or women planning to conceive. Adequate research is not available on children's use. How Often? 3 to 8 grams/ day in the form of tablets; 1-3 ml of damiana tincture or 1-3 gram leaves brewed as a tea daily. Caution Overdosing may lead to diarrhea or trigger menstruation. In This Article What Is Damiana? What Is The Importance Of Its Leaves? Damiana (Turnera diffusa) is a popular aphrodisiac that is extensively grown in Brazil, Bolivia, Mexico, and the West Indies. The pale green leaves of this perennial shrub are used in folk medicine to brew healing teas. Damiana leaf tea is said to relieve mild depression, weakness, anxiety, fever, cough, skin disorders, dyspepsiai [X]Recurrent pain, burning sensation, gassiness, or discomfort in the upper abdomen that often occurs after eating or drinking. , digestion, and hangover. Above all, it [stimulates metabolism](https://www.stylecraze.com/articles/wonder-foods-to-boost-your-metabolism/), menstruation, and sexual drive ( [1](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/277300695_Evaluation_of_aphrodisiac_activity_of_Turnera_aphrodisiaca)), ( [2](http://www.herbalsafety.utep.edu/herbal-fact-sheets/damiana/)). The leaves are also smoked for a narcotic effect, similar to marijuana. Damiana leaf has potent antinociceptive properties ( [2](http://www.herbalsafety.utep.edu/herbal-fact-sheets/damiana/)). Due to the powerful phytochemicalsi [X]Bioactive plant chemicals found in fruits and veggies that act against bacteria, viruses, and fungi. it contains, this leaf may help to heal a variety of ailments. Take a look. What Are The Benefits Of Damiana Leaf? 1. Aphrodisiac: Improves Libido, Sexual Health, And Potency A few rat studies demonstrated the positive effect of damiana on sexual performance. It was found that an 80 mg/kg dose of damiana extract increased the number of males resuming a second ejaculatory series right after finishing the first one. The interval between the two rounds also reduced ( [3](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3731873/)). Homeopathy recommends the use of damiana with zinc phosphide, arsenious acid, and cocaine in medicinal dosages to cure erectile dysfunction ( [4](https://www.press.uchicago.edu/Misc/Chicago/500768.html)). Folklore has it that damiana leaf might treat spermatorrhea, premature ejaculation, and several prostate complaints ( [5](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=12CA925C1D48A9DDAC8EEF7FA1E68E7D?doi=10.1.1.376.4809&&rep=rep1&&type=pdf)). Also, the damiana leaf may affect fertility issues by boosting sexual desire, stimulating arousal, and increasing sexual drive/pleasure in women ( [6](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/23410203_Anti-aromatase_activity_of_the_constituents_from_damiana_Turnera_diffusa)). This effect might involve the nitric oxide (NO) pathway. Regulating nitric oxide levels in the body has been shown to improve sex life in rats ( [7](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23298455)). Did You Know? - Damiana acts as an emmenagoguei [X]A substance or agent that stimulates blood flow in the pelvic area and promotes menstrual discharge. . This herbal extract can stimulate menstruation. - It can relieve headaches, cramps, and other stresses caused due to menstruation and menopause ( [5](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=12CA925C1D48A9DDAC8EEF7FA1E68E7D?doi=10.1.1.376.4809&&rep=rep1&&type=pdf)). - In Mexico, damiana is used to flavor teas, liquors, beverages, and many local foods ( [5](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=12CA925C1D48A9DDAC8EEF7FA1E68E7D?doi=10.1.1.376.4809&&rep=rep1&&type=pdf)). 2. Anxiolytic: Controls Anxiety, Depression, And Nervousness Alcoholic and aqueous extracts of damiana, also known as tinctures, have potent anti-anxiety properties. These formulations relieve depression and nervousness and [improve blood circulation](https://www.stylecraze.com/articles/effective-home-remedies-for-improving-blood-circulation/) in men and women. It may aid relaxation and improve your energy and mood. It may also give a transient 'high' and hallucinations similar to [marijuana](https://www.stylecraze.com/articles/surprising-benefits-and-uses-of-marijuana-tea/) while acting as a stimulant ( [5](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=12CA925C1D48A9DDAC8EEF7FA1E68E7D?doi=10.1.1.376.4809&&rep=rep1&&type=pdf)). Phytochemicalsi [X]Bioactive plant chemicals found in fruits and veggies that act against bacteria, viruses, and fungi. including flavonoidsi [X]A group of natural substances found in almost all fruits and veggies with anti-inflammatory and disease-fighting properties. , alkaloids, and steroids are behind this property ( [8](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1062162/)). Apigenin, one such flavonoid in the leaves of this plant, has a notable anxiolytic effect ( [9](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3040895/)). All thanks to its biochemical composition, damiana leaf (predominantly, Turnera aphrodisiaca) can help address CNS disorders - in traditional medicine and as per The British Herbal Pharmacopoeia ( [8](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1062162/)). 3. Digestive And Anti-diabetic: Aids Damiana plant is an [excellent digestive aid](https://www.stylecraze.com/articles/healthy-foods-for-good-digestion/). It has been used in digestive and [weight loss](https://www.stylecraze.com/articles/health-and-wellness/weight-loss/) formulations in folk and new-age medicine. These herbs trigger the secretion of gastric and bile juices ( [5](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=12CA925C1D48A9DDAC8EEF7FA1E68E7D?doi=10.1.1.376.4809&&rep=rep1&&type=pdf)), ( [10](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2927017/)). The extract also has mild laxative effects. Damiana, in small doses, can stimulate the bowel movement and prevent spasms due to [constipation](https://www.stylecraze.com/articles/effective-home-remedies-to-cure-constipation/) ( [5](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=12CA925C1D48A9DDAC8EEF7FA1E68E7D?doi=10.1.1.376.4809&&rep=rep1&&type=pdf)). A capsule with yerba mate, guarana, and damiana leaves caused a delay in gastric emptying and increased the time to feel gastric fullness. A 45-day course of this capsule brought about weight loss in overweight patients ( [11](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2704217/)). What makes these wild leaves exceptionally beneficial for your sexual and digestive health? Check out the next section to find out. What Are The Active Components Of Damiana Leaf? Both the species of damiana have an abundance of flavonoidsi [X]A group of natural substances found in almost all fruits and veggies with anti-inflammatory and disease-fighting properties. , hydrocarbons, hexacosanol are identified in the plant ( [12](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3040867/)). The leaf contains up to 1% volatile oil rich in cineole, -copaene, and calamene ( Wondering how to and how much you should take? Keep reading! How (Much) Do You Take Damiana Leaf? Generally, damiana leaves are brewed to make slightly bitter and mild tea or infusion. And how do you make it? In three simple steps! Here you go! Step 1: Boil 1 cup (250 ml) water. Step 2: Add ½ cup (1 g) of dried damiana leaves. Step 3: Let it steep for 15 minutes. That's it! Drink this infusion 2-3 times a day. Alternatively, you can try taking 1-3 ml of damiana tincture, two to three times a day. If you wish to try the capsules or tablets, 3-8 g, twice a day, is a safe dosage. You don't have to worry about side effects (if used within the dosages provided) because there are none documented till date. This is also why the US FDA has approved the usage of damiana in foods ( [5](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=12CA925C1D48A9DDAC8EEF7FA1E68E7D?doi=10.1.1.376.4809&&rep=rep1&&type=pdf)). However, we recommend you to keep the following points in mind before trying damiana. Are There Any Precautions Or Risks Associated With Damiana Leaf? Scientific literature and research claim that damiana and its leaves are one of the safest supplements for enhancing sexual performance ( [5](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=12CA925C1D48A9DDAC8EEF7FA1E68E7D?doi=10.1.1.376.4809&&rep=rep1&&type=pdf)). There are almost no or minimal side effects reported against damiana. There are also no proven drug interactions with this herb ( [5](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=12CA925C1D48A9DDAC8EEF7FA1E68E7D?doi=10.1.1.376.4809&&rep=rep1&&type=pdf)). In case of an overdose, you might pass loose stools because of the herb's laxative effect ( [5](http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download;jsessionid=12CA925C1D48A9DDAC8EEF7FA1E68E7D?doi=10.1.1.376.4809&&rep=rep1&&type=pdf)). Caution! If you are pregnant or planning on conception, stay away from damiana because it is a potent emmenagoguei [X]A substance or agent that stimulates blood flow in the pelvic area and promotes menstrual discharge. . Damiana can induce menstruation in women. It might result in abortion or a stillborn if you did not refrain from the supplementation. Please consult your doctor about taking this herbal medicine in any case. Infographic: All About Damiana Leaf Damiana leaf extracts are often featured in alcoholic drinks. Folk medicine considers them as aphrodisiacs and offers anecdotal evidence for their use. Frequently Asked Questions Can you take ashwagandha and damiana together? Yes, ashwagandha can be taken with damiana. The two work as aphrodisiacs and improve libido. Are damiana and rosemary the same? No, damiana and rosemary are not the same. While rosemary is a fragrant herb, damiana is a medicinal shrub. Does Damiana affect kidneys? Yes, animal studies suggest that damiana leaves have antioxidant properties that may reduce oxidative stress in the kidneys in diabetic rats ( [13](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/14786419.2017.1380009?journalCode=gnpl20#:~:text=Damiana%20significantly%20reduced%20the%20MDA,potential%20to%20reverse%20the%20hyperglycaemia.)). However, further studies are needed to support this claim. Does Damiana affect testosterone? Yes, studies suggest that damiana leaves may inhibit aromatase (enzyme) activity, which in turn, may increase testosterone levels in the blood ( [14](https://www.ars.usda.gov/research/publications/publication/?seqNo115=242750)). However, further studies are needed to support this claim. Key Takeaways - Damiana (Turnera diffusa), known for its aphrodisiac properties, is largely grown in Brazil, Bolivia, Mexico, and the West Indies. - Damiana acts as a digestive aid and promotes the secretion of gastric and bile juices. - Also, it can control anxiety, depression, and nervousness.
